## GAD-7 vs ICQ

GAD-7 vs ICQ The Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Infant Characteristics Questionnaire (ICQ) are two widely-used psychological instruments. They serve distinct purposes with GAD-7 acting as a measure for anxiety severity, while the ICQ assesses the ease or difficulty in understanding an infant's needs and responses. When studying the correlations between anxiety levels in mothers and behaviours in infants, GAD-7 vs ICQ becomes an important comparison. This is where Harmony software steps into play. Making use of the advanced natural language processing and generative AI models, Harmony can help in comparing and harmonising the items from GAD-7 and ICQ, significantly easing the process for researchers. The GAD-7 vs ICQ comparison becomes more reliable and less time-consuming, making it possible to carry out longitudinal studies across multiple psychological realms. With the use of Harmony's state-of-the-art technology, no comparison is out of reach. Whether you are comparing domestically, or cross-culturally in different languages, the process of questionnaire harmonisation is accurately performed by Harmony. So, when it comes to GAD-7 vs ICQ and conducting longitudinal analysis or comparative studies, Harmony is the go-to software tool, making your research journey efficient, objective, and reliable.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
